sentences.sContent: Some US industries are not as competitive as they have been in the past.
sentences.sCn: 美国有些行业不如以前有竞争力了。

sentences.sContent: The team seems to have lost its competitive edge recently (= its ability to compete well ) .
sentences.sCn: 这支球队近来好像丧失了竞争优势。

sentences.sContent: ...government officials were recruited through competitive examinations...
...graduates will become more competitive in job hunting...
...Does innovation on this scale really give a competitive advantage...
...competitive full-time positions: the Swedish policies have given them the freedom and opportunity to live the lives they prefer...
...Sweden is one of the most competitive economies in the world and its people enjoy the greatest life satisfaction...
...the World Economic Forum ranked Sweden as the world's third mast competitive economy; the United States came in fifth...
...are reducing the number of women in elite competitive positions...
...Their answer：Broad-based welfare-state policies hinder women's representation in elite competitive positions...

synos.tran: 竞争的；比赛的；求胜心切的

phrases.pCn: 竞争价格；公开招标价格
竞争态势；竞争环境；竞争性的局面
竞争地位；竟争水平，竞争能力
竞技性运动；竞赛体育运动
竞争激烈的就业市场；充满竞争的就业市场

trans.tranCn: 竞争的， 比赛的； 好竞争的， 求胜心切的； 有竞争力的
trans.tranOther: determined or trying very hard to be more successful than other people or businesses
